docs.lead_paragraph: These days, even those who don't drink Starbucks coffee know that the sleek green-logoed chain is blighted by the business blues.

headline.main: In Bryant Park, a Coffee Chain Looks for a Fresh Start

docs.abstract: Starbucks tries to reinvigorate its brand by heading back to its roots with a nationwide coffee tasting and a Bryant Park replica of its original Seattle store.
docs.snippet: Starbucks tries to reinvigorate its brand by heading back to its roots with a nationwide coffee tasting and a Bryant Park replica of its original Seattle store.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the greatest things about the Web is that -- as opposed to, say, the letters section of the New York Review of Books -- the allotted space for literary and ideological feuds is more or less infinite. One of the more interesting recent running dramas has involved two men who say they are old friends: Time magazine bigshot and "Primary Colors" author Joe Klein and former Bush White House staffer Peter Wehner, who writes at Commentary.

headline.main: Patriot Acts, No Curtain in Sight

docs.abstract: Two political observers (and friends) exchange thoughts on patriotism. Vigorously
docs.snippet: Two political observers (and friends) exchange thoughts on patriotism. Vigorously

docs.lead_paragraph: The Clinton campaign is flooding the airwaves in Pennsylvania with five new ads today as a new poll shows Senator Barack Obama narrowing the gap with Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton in a state where she had been comfortably ahead.
docs.abstract: The Clinton campaign is flooding the airwaves in Pennsylvania with five new ads today.
docs.snippet: The Clinton campaign is flooding the airwaves in Pennsylvania with five new ads today.

docs.lead_paragraph: Striking teachers at Catholic schools announced on Monday night that they had temporarily suspended their job action against the Archdiocese of New York.

headline.main: Teachers at Catholic Schools Suspend Strike
headline.print_headline: Teachers at Catholic Schools Suspend Strike

docs.snippet: Striking teachers at Catholic schools announced on Monday night that they had temporarily suspended their job action against the Archdiocese of New York.
